actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

official_title: A bill to amend title 38, of the United States Code, in order to credit physicians and dentists with 20 or more years of service in the Veterans' Administration with certain service for retirement purposes.

summary.text: Grants credit for retirement purposes to physicians and dentists employed by the Veterans' Administration for a period of 20 years or more, with service equal to the period of time spent in pursuit of the professional doctorate degree up to a maximum allowance of five years. Provides, before benefits can be credited that the physician or dentist must deposit a determined amount in the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. (Amends 38 U.S.C. 4109)

titles.title: A bill to amend title 38, of the United States Code, in order to credit physicians and dentists with 20 or more years of service in the Veterans' Administration with certain service for retirement purposes.
